{"step_by_step_thinking": "Cytopathic effect refers to the structural changes in host cells that are caused by viral invasion. The infecting virus causes lysis of the host cell or when the cell dies without lysis due to an inability to reproduce. Bacteria, spirochetes, and anaerobes are all types of bacteria, not viruses, so they do not cause a cytopathic effect.", "answer_choice": "A"}
